title: 110_s2476
content: The "Improved Vaccine Supply Act" is cited as the short title. It amends the Public Health Service Act to include a new section on adequate vaccine supply. The Secretary will develop a plan for purchasing and storing a supply of vaccines for children and adults to cover recommended vaccinations for a 6-month period. The Secretary will supply vaccines for children and adults as recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices, including additional vaccines designated for public health. The Secretary will supply vaccines for adults designated by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices, including other vaccines for public health preparedness efforts. The Secretary will use specific authorities under the Social Security Act and section 317 to carry out this supply. The Secretary will submit a plan under section 1928(d)(6) of the Social Security Act to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions of the Senate within 6 months of enactment. This plan will utilize authorities under section 317 and other relevant authorities for vaccines described in paragraph (2)(B). The Secretary will submit a plan to relevant committees detailing the basis and prioritization of vaccine purchases within 6 months of enactment. The plan submitted by the Secretary will discuss the basis and prioritization of vaccine purchases, with full implementation required by September 30, 2008. Manufacturer contracts will be required to maintain the vaccine supply. The Secretary will require vaccine manufacturers to provide at least 1 year notice of any discontinuance of vaccine production to maintain the vaccine supply. The Secretary may reduce the notification period for vaccine discontinuance if the manufacturer certifies good cause. Proceeds from vaccine sales will be available for the Secretary's use. Proceeds from vaccine sales will be available to the Secretary for purchasing additional vaccines. The Secretary is required to submit ongoing reports periodically to specified committees. The Secretary must submit periodic reports detailing progress and any obstacles in implementing the vaccine plan developed. The first report should include a recommendation on vaccine distribution. The Secretary must submit periodic reports detailing progress and any obstacles in implementing the vaccine plan developed. The first report should include a recommendation on vaccine distribution, extending the supply beyond the initial 6-month period if necessary. Authorization of appropriations is provided for fiscal years 2008 through 2012.
